description: ExternalSecret is the Schema for the external-secrets API.

apiVersion.description:
APIVersion defines the versioned schema of this representation of an object.
Servers should convert recognized schemas to the latest internal value, and
may reject unrecognized values.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#resources

kind.description:
Kind is a string value representing the REST resource this object represents.
Servers may infer this from the endpoint the client submits requests to.
Cannot be updated.
In CamelCase.
More info: https://git.k8s.io/community/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#types-kinds

spec.description: ExternalSecretSpec defines the desired state of ExternalSecret.

data.description: Data defines the connection between the Kubernetes Secret keys and the Provider data

items.description: ExternalSecretData defines the connection between the Kubernetes Secret key (spec.data.<key>) and the Provider data.

conversionStrategy.description: Used to define a conversion Strategy

key.description: Key is the key used in the Provider, mandatory

property.description: Used to select a specific property of the Provider value (if a map), if supported

version.description: Used to select a specific version of the Provider value, if supported

dataFrom.description:
DataFrom is used to fetch all properties from a specific Provider data
If multiple entries are specified, the Secret keys are merged in the specified order

conversionStrategy.description: Used to define a conversion Strategy

key.description: Key is the key used in the Provider, mandatory

property.description: Used to select a specific property of the Provider value (if a map), if supported

version.description: Used to select a specific version of the Provider value, if supported

refreshInterval.description:
RefreshInterval is the amount of time before the values are read again from the SecretStore provider
Valid time units are "ns", "us" (or "µs"), "ms", "s", "m", "h"
May be set to zero to fetch and create it once. Defaults to 1h.

secretStoreRef.description: SecretStoreRef defines which SecretStore to fetch the ExternalSecret data.

kind.description:
Kind of the SecretStore resource (SecretStore or ClusterSecretStore)
Defaults to `SecretStore`

target.description:
ExternalSecretTarget defines the Kubernetes Secret to be created
There can be only one target per ExternalSecret.

creationPolicy.description:
CreationPolicy defines rules on how to create the resulting Secret
Defaults to 'Owner'

immutable.description: Immutable defines if the final secret will be immutable

name.description:
Name defines the name of the Secret resource to be managed
This field is immutable
Defaults to the .metadata.name of the ExternalSecret resource

template.description: Template defines a blueprint for the created Secret resource.

engineVersion.description:
EngineVersion specifies the template engine version
that should be used to compile/execute the
template specified in .data and .templateFrom[].

metadata.description: ExternalSecretTemplateMetadata defines metadata fields for the Secret blueprint.

binding.description: Binding represents a servicebinding.io Provisioned Service reference to the secret

name.description:
Name of the referent.
This field is effectively required, but due to backwards compatibility is
allowed to be empty. Instances of this type with an empty value here are
almost certainly wrong.
More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/overview/working-with-objects/names/#names

refreshTime.description:
refreshTime is the time and date the external secret was fetched and
the target secret updated

syncedResourceVersion.description: SyncedResourceVersion keeps track of the last synced version
